pros: Supportive management and co workers
cons: Pay was low for the job being done

job_title: Financial Case Manager in Rochester, NY
pros: You learn a lot on the job. There's a lot of useful information if you're someone who wants to stay in a human services/community support role. I've seen other workplace reviews say poor things about the work culture of the staff here, but I really think that depends on the team you are hired with. I personally had no issues with my relationships with my coworkers, and I felt that my supervisors were super committed to their roles and were very approachable. When I left it was still a hybrid role which was highly flexible. You also had complete autonomy over how you went about your agenda.
cons: The pay is (unsurprisingly) very low. It's not a livable wage. There's constant turnover so it can be hard to keep morale high -- it's why I left. I didn't want to switch employers but the lack of sufficient pay basically forced me to.

pros: Flexibility. Ability to essentially make your own hours is a plus.
cons: Hourly pay is simply not enough. Perhaps for someone straight out of college but pay can be way better.

review_title: Preached diversity and growth. Company falls flat
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Rochester, NY
pros: flexible schedule during the covid times
cons:
* company talks the talk of diversity and inclusion but falls hugely flat in its execution. Unless you are a younger, female person of color who is not straight you face microaggressions and discrimination.
* companies open door policy is a joke. all levels of employees are able to bring concerns directly to the CEO with her never directly addressing them with the employee but takes their word as gospel. 
* only agency I have ever worked for where people spend more time pointing fingers at other people and other departments than to take their own accountability
.* agency has no leadership. it is lead by a group of individuals with guidance from the ceo is that they do whatever the majority wants.

pros: Fulfilling work, great clients, good location for going out to lunch
cons: Bad leadership, poor pay, heavy caseloads

job_title: Community Outreach Counselor in Rochester, NY
pros: Flexible hours, very little supervision
cons: Low pay, very little supervision

pros: very good but not at the same time
cons: honestly leaving a review to view others

review_title: Rewarding Human Services Job If You Don't Mind The Salary
pros: I enjoy the professional and rewarding relationships with the clients, the flexible hours, working at different locations, and interacting with happy staff who are easy to get along with.  It is by far the most rewarding job (warm fuzzies) that I have ever had in my life.  I know I'm making a contribution to an emerging field.
cons: Relief Counselors do not have a good salary given their responsibilities, and their are no benefits either.  However, given that it is a non-profit in a human services field, you can only expect so much.

review_title: Great entry level position to learn more about the behavioral health field
pros: Flexible schedule, good benefits, supportive staff, positive work environment, opportunities for community outreach, ability to make a difference in the lives of those suffering from mental illness and addiction
cons: Confusing role between clinical and residential duties (could be cleaning someones apartment and counseling someone with suicidal ideations in the same day), on call system with minimal incentives

review_title: Ok job out of school but that's about it
pros: Good experience out of school. Its a stepping stone job with no long term incentives. Some benefits were good
cons: Bad pay, bad scheduling, over worked, very high turnover
